moves.1. e4 d5: The first two moves are obvious because they are commonly played.
moves.2. exd5 Qxd5: This starts as my opponent's gameplan is to be turned into a knightmare (get it?).
moves.3. Nc3 Qe5+: I didn't see this, but it's just as worthless as all other moves black could do.
moves.4. Be2: I was reminded that this was a good move.
moves.4... Qg5: Two options that I was torn about: 5.d4, or 5.Nf3.
moves.5. Nf3: Although I lost a pawn, I did not care. Black's in a terrible position.
moves.5... Qxg2 6. Rf1: I missed 6.Rg1. Oh well, it seems about time that I stop bugging the Queen around and start developing the rest of my pieces.
moves.7. d4 b6 8. Rg1: I left Black no other option for his move.
moves.8... Qh3 9. Rg3: "Thanks for standing there, insane Queen!" -my Rook.
moves.9... Qe6 10. d5: "I can do this all day!" -my d-pawn
moves.14. Qd3 Be6 15. Nd4 Qd6: I won...unless...there's something luckier than this.
moves.16. Ncb5 Qd5: I don't know why Black didn't resign after this move?
moves.17. Nc7+ Kd8 18. Nxd5: I win a Bishop too because Black's tempted to take my Knight.
moves.19... Ke8: Two options: I could re-fork Black and earn his rook...
moves.20. Qxd5: or I could take his Rook in a more torture-some way.
moves.20... Rc8: Before revealing the answer, can you tell me how to mate in two?
moves.21... Rb8: He could also take my rook, which would be a mate in two or three afterward.
moves.22. Nc7#: Lesson: Don't be too greedy and also, ward yourself away from taking the d5 pawn on move two with the Queen.
